document.docTitle: Sathytes communis Shen & Yin 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Five new species and a new record of Sathytes Westwood from eastern China (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Pselaphinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Five new species and a new record of Sathytes Westwood from eastern China (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Pselaphinae)

leaf litter, sifted,

’.

Diagnostic description. Male. Body ( Fig. 1A ) dark reddish-brown, mouthparts and tarsi paler. Body length 1.55–1.61 mm . Head wider than long, length from anterior margin of clypeus to base 0.32–0.36 mm , width across eyes 0.38–0.41 mm . Each eye composed of about 20 facets. Length of eyes ( 0.15 mm ) / length of tempora ( 0.07 mm ) approximately 2.1:1. Length of antennae 0.81–0.83 mm ; club ( Fig. 1B ) formed by antennomeres 9–11; inner margin of antennomere 9 ( Fig. 1C ) expanded, with semi-membranous apophysis at apex of expansion, and at approximately basal 1/3 of antennomere; antennomere 10 strongly transverse, obconical; antennomere 11 ( Fig. 1B ) about 1.7 times as long as wide, with one apically concave basal protuberance covered with tuft of setae at apex ( Fig. 1D ). Pronotum about as long as broad, length along midline 0.39–0.41 mm , maximum width 0.40–0.42 mm . Elytra slightly transverse, length along suture 0.52–0.56 mm , maximum width 0.60–0.63 mm .Abdomen widest at tergite 1 ( IV ), and narrowing apically; mid-length of dorsally exposed part 0.38–0.42 mm , maximum width 0.53–0.56 mm . Length of aedeagus ( Fig. 1E ) 0.17 mm ; median lobe slightly asymmetric, with angularly protuberant apex.

Female. Body length 1.55–1.57 mm . Head wider than long, length from anterior margin of clypeus to base 0.32–0.33 mm , width across eyes 0.37–0.39 mm . Each eye composed of about 14 facets. Length of eyes ( 0.13 mm ) / length of tempora ( 0.07 mm ) approximately 1.9:1. Length of antennae 0.68–0.71 mm . Pronotum about as long as broad, length along midline 0.38–0.39 mm , maximum width 0.38–0.40 mm . Elytra slightly transverse, length along suture 0.47–0.50 mm , maximum width 0.55–0.56 mm . Abdomen widest at tergite 1 ( IV ), and narrowing apically; mid-length of dorsally exposed part 0.40–0.51 mm , maximum width 0.52–0.56 mm .

Comparative notes.
Sathytes communis
shares with
Sathytes longwangshanus Yin & Li
a similar body size ( 1.55–1.61 mm vs. 1.54 mm ), and a transverse antennomere 9 with the apophysis located at basal 1/3 ( Fig. 1C ;
Yin et al . 2012
: fig. 7E). These two species can be readily separated by the single basal protuberance on the antennomere 11 in the new species, while there is one basal and one subbasal protuberance in
S . longwangshanus
. Distribution. China : Anhui , Zhejiang , Jiangxi . Etymology. The specific name indicates that it is a widely distributed species.
